title: Tomahawk
data:
***Obsolete**: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.*

| Name                                           | Tomahawk                         |
| :--------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------- |
| Launcher                                       | [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") |
| Base damage                                    | 6                                |
| [Base delay](/Weapon_speed "Weapon speed") (%) | 13 (130%)                        |
| [Min delay](/Minimum_delay "Minimum delay")    | 7 at skill 12                    |

|   |                                     |
| - | ----------------------------------- |
|   | A small axe, designed for throwing. |

**Tomahawks** were a form of [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") weapon directly between [stones](/Stone "Stone") and [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") in terms of power. Although somewhat less powerful than javelins, they could be thrown by all characters regardless of size and were still capable of inflicting decent damage.

Tomahawks can have the following brands:

- [Dispersal](/Dispersal_\(brand\) "Dispersal (brand)")
- [Poisoned](/Poisoned "Poisoned")
- [Silver](/Silver "Silver")
- [Steel](/Steel "Steel")
- [Returning](/Returning "Returning")
- [Exploding](/Exploding "Exploding")

Tomahawks have a mulch rate of 5%, meaning there is a 1-in-20 chance that they will be destroyed each time the player throws them. Tomahawks branded with exploding or dispersal will always be destroyed on hit.

## Strategy

- Characters should pick these up without fail on the first few floors. Having a source of ranged damage output, even an unreliable one, can make a big difference. Softening up inescapable [adders](/Adder "Adder") before engaging them in melee can greatly improve a level 1 or 2 characters' chance of survival. That being said, [ogres](/Ogre_\(monster\) "Ogre (monster)") and [gnolls](/Gnoll_\(monster\) "Gnoll (monster)") may still be worth running from - your tomahawks might soften them up first, but it doesn't take many hits from a [halberd](/Halberd "Halberd") or [giant spiked club](/Giant_spiked_club "Giant spiked club") to take out weak adventurers.
- Dispersal tomahawks can be very handy for situations where you need an opponent to back off, but remember that you need to deal damage for the brand to trigger. Characters with no Throwing skill may have trouble doing so against enemies with decent [AC](/AC "AC").

| Common                                                              | Magical                                                             | Silver                                                                                | Steel                                                                              |
| ------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [![Tomahawk1.png](/images/1/1e/Tomahawk1.png)](/File:Tomahawk1.png) | [![Tomahawk2.png](/images/2/2b/Tomahawk2.png)](/File:Tomahawk2.png) | [![Silver tomahawk.png](/images/d/da/Silver_tomahawk.png)](/File:Silver_tomahawk.png) | [![Steel tomahawk.png](/images/f/f1/Steel_tomahawk.png)](/File:Steel_tomahawk.png) |

## History

- In [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), tomahawks were replaced by [boomerangs](/Boomerang "Boomerang"), which innately have the [returning](/Returning "Returning") property.
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), you needed 27 [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") skill to reach min delay.
- In [0.17](/0.17 "0.17"), [exploding](/Exploding "Exploding") tomahawks were introduced.
- Tomahawks were added in [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), compensating for the fact that smaller melee weapons (such as [hand axes](/Hand_axe "Hand axe") and [spears](/Spear "Spear")) were no longer throwable. Smaller species whose backgrounds would normally start with [javelins](/Javelin "Javelin") (such as [Hunters](/Hunter "Hunter")) were instead given the option of starting with tomahawks.

| [Weapons](/Weapon "Weapon")                          |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ---------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Axes](/Axes "Axes")                                 | [Battleaxe](/Battleaxe "Battleaxe") • [Broad axe](/Broad_axe "Broad axe") • [Executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe") • [Hand axe](/Hand_axe "Hand axe") • [War axe](/War_axe "War axe")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") | [Club](/Club "Club") • [Demon whip](/Demon_whip "Demon whip") • [Dire flail](/Dire_flail "Dire flail") • [Eveningstar](/Eveningstar "Eveningstar") • [Flail](/Flail "Flail") • [Giant club](/Giant_club "Giant club") • [Giant spiked club](/Giant_spiked_club "Giant spiked club") • [Great mace](/Great_mace "Great mace") • [Mace](/Mace "Mace") ([Hammer](/Hammer "Hammer")) • [Morningstar](/Morningstar "Morningstar") • [Sacred scourge](/Sacred_scourge "Sacred scourge") • [Whip](/Whip "Whip") |
| [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")            | [Demon blade](/Demon_blade "Demon blade") • [Double sword](/Double_sword "Double sword") • [Eudemon blade](/Eudemon_blade "Eudemon blade") • [Falchion](/Falchion "Falchion") • [Great sword](/Great_sword "Great sword") • [Long sword](/Long_sword "Long sword") • [Scimitar](/Scimitar "Scimitar") • [Triple sword](/Triple_sword "Triple sword")                                                                                                                                                     |
| [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")                     | [Bardiche](/Bardiche "Bardiche") • [Demon trident](/Demon_trident "Demon trident") • [Glaive](/Glaive "Glaive") • [Halberd](/Halberd "Halberd") ([Scythe](/Scythe "Scythe")) • [Spear](/Spear "Spear") • [Trident](/Trident "Trident") • [Trishula](/Trishula "Trishula")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")   | [Arbalest](/Arbalest "Arbalest") • [Hand cannon](/Hand_cannon "Hand cannon") • [Longbow](/Longbow "Longbow") • [Orcbow](/Orcbow "Orcbow") • [Shortbow](/Shortbow "Shortbow") • [Sling](/Sling "Sling") • [Triple crossbow](/Triple_crossbow "Triple crossbow")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")         | [Dagger](/Dagger "Dagger") • [Quick blade](/Quick_blade "Quick blade") • [Rapier](/Rapier "Rapier") • [Short sword](/Short_sword "Short sword")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| [Staves](/Staves "Staves")                           | [Lajatang](/Lajatang "Lajatang") • [Magical staff](/Magical_staff "Magical staff") • [Quarterstaff](/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")                     | [Boomerang](/Boomerang "Boomerang") • [Dart](/Dart "Dart") • [Javelin](/Javelin "Javelin") • [Large rock](/Large_rock "Large rock") • [Stone](/Stone "Stone") • [Throwing net](/Throwing_net "Throwing net")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
html:
Tomahawk

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Obsolete: This article refers to an aspect of the game which has been removed. It is retained for historical reference only.
Name Tomahawk
Launcher Throwing
Base damage 6
Base delay (%) 13 (130%)
Min delay 7 at skill 12
A small axe, designed for throwing.

Tomahawks were a form of Throwing weapon directly between stones and javelins in terms of power. Although somewhat less powerful than javelins, they could be thrown by all characters regardless of size and were still capable of inflicting decent damage.

Tomahawks can have the following brands:

  • Dispersal
  • Poisoned
  • Silver
  • Steel
  • Returning
  • Exploding

Tomahawks have a mulch rate of 5%, meaning there is a 1-in-20 chance that they will be destroyed each time the player throws them. Tomahawks branded with exploding or dispersal will always be destroyed on hit.

Strategy

  • Characters should pick these up without fail on the first few floors. Having a source of ranged damage output, even an unreliable one, can make a big difference. Softening up inescapable adders before engaging them in melee can greatly improve a level 1 or 2 characters' chance of survival. That being said, ogres and gnolls may still be worth running from - your tomahawks might soften them up first, but it doesn't take many hits from a halberd or giant spiked club to take out weak adventurers.
  • Dispersal tomahawks can be very handy for situations where you need an opponent to back off, but remember that you need to deal damage for the brand to trigger. Characters with no Throwing skill may have trouble doing so against enemies with decent AC.
Common Magical Silver Steel

History

  • In 0.24, tomahawks were replaced by boomerangs, which innately have the returning property.
  • Prior to 0.18, you needed 27 Throwing skill to reach min delay.
  • In 0.17, exploding tomahawks were introduced.
  • Tomahawks were added in 0.14, compensating for the fact that smaller melee weapons (such as hand axes and spears) were no longer throwable. Smaller species whose backgrounds would normally start with javelins (such as Hunters) were instead given the option of starting with tomahawks.
Weapons
Axes Battleaxe • Broad axe • Executioner's axe • Hand axe • War axe
Maces & Flails Club • Demon whip • Dire flail • Eveningstar • Flail • Giant club • Giant spiked club • Great mace • Mace (Hammer) • Morningstar • Sacred scourge • Whip
Long Blades Demon blade • Double sword • Eudemon blade • Falchion • Great sword • Long sword • Scimitar • Triple sword
Polearms Bardiche • Demon trident • Glaive • Halberd (Scythe) • Spear • Trident • Trishula
Ranged Weapons Arbalest • Hand cannon • Longbow • Orcbow • Shortbow • Sling • Triple crossbow
Short Blades Dagger • Quick blade • Rapier • Short sword
Staves Lajatang • Magical staff • Quarterstaff
Throwing Boomerang • Dart • Javelin • Large rock • Stone • Throwing net

{{Flavour|A small axe, designed for throwing.}}

'''Tomahawks''' were a form of [[Throwing]] weapon directly between [[stone]]s and [[javelin]]s in terms of power. Although somewhat less powerful than javelins, they could be thrown by all characters regardless of size and were still capable of inflicting decent damage.

Tomahawks can have the following brands:
*[[Dispersal (brand)|Dispersal]]
*[[Poisoned]]
*[[Silver]]
*[[Steel]]
*[[Returning]]
*[[Exploding]]

Tomahawks have a mulch rate of 5%, meaning there is a 1-in-20 chance that they will be destroyed each time the player throws them. Tomahawks branded with exploding or dispersal will always be destroyed on hit.

==Strategy==
*Characters should pick these up without fail on the first few floors. Having a source of ranged damage output, even an unreliable one, can make a big difference. Softening up inescapable [[adder]]s before engaging them in melee can greatly improve a level 1 or 2 characters' chance of survival. That being said, [[ogre (monster)|ogres]] and [[gnoll (monster)|gnolls]] may still be worth running from - your tomahawks might soften them up first, but it doesn't take many hits from a [[halberd]] or [[giant spiked club]] to take out weak adventurers.
*Dispersal tomahawks can be very handy for situations where you need an opponent to back off, but remember that you need to deal damage for the brand to trigger. Characters with no Throwing skill may have trouble doing so against enemies with decent [[AC]].

==History==
*In [[0.24]], tomahawks were replaced by [[boomerang]]s, which innately have the [[returning]] property.
*Prior to [[0.18]], you needed 27 [[Throwing]] skill to reach min delay.
*In [[0.17]], [[exploding]] tomahawks were introduced.
*Tomahawks were added in [[0.14]], compensating for the fact that smaller melee weapons (such as [[hand axe]]s and [[spear]]s) were no longer throwable. Smaller species whose backgrounds would normally start with [[javelin]]s (such as [[Hunter]]s) were instead given the option of starting with tomahawks.
